items.title: Best Movies to watch for Programmers/Developers
items.author: Dids Irwyn T. Reyes
items.description:
are you looking for entertaining films on computer programming, software development, and technology? I’ve gathered my top films for software developers/programmers here.

You don’t have a Netflix subscription? If you’re reading this, I’m sure you can watch this on the internet right now for free, with or without the use of illegal platforms 😏

  1. ) Tetris (2023)

This is so far one of the best movies i have watched this Year (2023)

History, Business, Action and of course Programming. If you played the Tetris game without knowing its history, then this movie is a must watch.

“But never underestimate the power of BASIC”

2. ) The Social Network (2010)

Facebook? Well I don’t have to explain why this is in the top 2 of my list.

The Social Network is a movie about the founding of Facebook by Mark Zuckerberg and his friend Eduardo Saverin. It follows the legal disputes that arose as the website gained popularity and explores themes of friendship, loyalty, and the cost of success. The film has been praised for its portrayal of the rise of social media and its impact on society, as well as its strong performances by the cast. The movie won multiple awards, including three Academy Awards.

3. ) Snowden (2016)

Snowden is a 2016 biographical thriller about the former NSA contractor who leaked classified information. Starring Joseph Gordon-Levitt, the movie explores Snowden’s motivations and the consequences of his actions, examining government surveillance and whistleblowers.

“Edward Snowden a Traitor or a Hero?”

Well watch it and its for you to decide.

4. ) Blackhat (2015)

Into Cybersecurity? or you’re a Script Kiddie? 😆 just kidding, then this movie is for you.

Blackhat is a 2015 action thriller about a hacker named Nick Hathaway, played by Chris Hemsworth, who is released from prison to help track down a cybercriminal network responsible for a hacking attack. The film explores themes of cybercrime, espionage, and international relations as Hathaway and his team race against time.

5. ) Jobs (2013)

Jobs is a 2013 biographical drama film that tells the story of Steve Jobs, the co-founder of Apple Inc. The movie stars Ashton Kutcher as Jobs and follows his journey from a college dropout to one of the most influential figures in the technology industry.

I’ll only post this list for the time being, and I’ll keep it updated. Well, if you haven’t made up your mind, you might want to watch The Imitation Game as well.

I’m writing this blog for me 😄 and for those who wants to try Neovim, i always forget my Nvim setup when changing to different Operating System and Linux Distribution.

This configuration works well in web development Elixir and Phoenix Framework, Typescript, Javascript, ReactJS.

Automated Testing: Playwright Framework

This is for current Linux Distro: Mint, Flavor: Cinnamon
Tested with Linux Distro: Ubuntu 22.04.2 LTS
Tested with macOS: Ventura 13.4, Catalina 10.15, Sierra 10.12

Header is available here: https://github.com/nvimdev/dashboard-nvim/wiki/Header-Preview

First step is to open terminal Ctrl + Alt + T on linux

Current linux distro does not have Git pre-installed

Run command first

sudo apt update
sudo apt install git

Enter command:

sudo add-apt-repository ppa:neovim-ppa/stable
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install neovim

This gets the latest version of nvim. running sudo apt install neovim will do it but other plugins wont work because the version that will be installed is lower than 0.7.0

function! ElixirUmbrellaTransform(cmd) abort
  if match(a:cmd, 'apps/') != -1
    return substitute(a:cmd, 'mix test apps/\([^/]*/\)', 'cd apps/\1 \&\& mix test ', '')
  else
    return a:cmd
  end
endfunction

function! RunPhoenixDialyxir()
  :w
  :silent !echo;echo;echo;echo;echo
  exec ":!time mix dialyzer"
endfunction

" Run Coverall in Project
function! RunPhoenixCoverall()
  :w
  :silent !echo;echo;echo;echo;echo
  exec ":!time mix coveralls"
endfunction

" Run Credo in Project
function! RunPhoenixCredo(filename)
  " Write the file and run tests for the given filename
  :w
  :silent !echo;echo;echo;echo;echo
  exec ":!time mix credo --strict " . a:filename
endfunction

" Run Credo in File
function! RunPhoenixCredoFile(...)
  if a:0
    let command_suffix = a:1
  else
    let command_suffix = ""
  endif

  call RunPhoenixCredo(@% . command_suffix)
endfunction

" Run Credo in Line
function! RunNearestCredoLine()
  let spec_line_number = line('.')
  call RunPhoenixCredoFile(":" . spec_line_number)
endfunction

items.title: Historical Negationism and the Rise of Cyber Propaganda
items.author: Dids Irwyn T. Reyes
items.description:
Since Ferdinand “Bongbong” Marcos Jr. also known as BBM, son of the late dictator and kleptocrat who served as the Philippines’ 10th president, ran and may officially be declared as the 17th President of the Philippines, the 2022 Philippine Election has been one of the most heated and contentious elections in history. The results of the election have dismayed the younger generation, as well as victims of martial law and those who do not favor the marcoses.

The question is how did Historical Negationism and Cyber Propaganda affect the elections?

“One prominent form of historical distortion regarding Ferdinand Marcos and his administration are various instances of historical denialism which involves trivializing the human rights violations and economic plunder that took place during the Marcos administration, as well as the role played by the rest of the Marcos family and by various Marcos cronies in the administration. Prominent examples of these are the Marcos family’s denials of economic plunder and the trivializing of human rights violations which took place during the Marcos administration.”

Wikipedia contributors. (2022, May 9). Historical distortion regarding Ferdinand Marcos. Wikipedia. Retrieved May 11, 2022, from https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Historical_distortion_regarding_Ferdinand_Marcos

In the year 2020, BBM approached Cambridge Analytica for a family rebranding, but then Marcos Jr. denied the allegations. Maria Ressa one of the journalists and authors on Rappler interviewed Brittany Kaiser, Cambridge Analytica’s former business development director turned whistleblower; Kaiser said in an interview that it’s being debated whether they will push this family rebranding or not.

https://medium.com/media/eee52d1916c90dace93fb5962d4ac372/href

“So we had a request straight from Bongbong Marcos to do a family rebranding… As you call it, historical revisionism, that’s exactly what it is. But it’s done in a data-driven and scientific way” — Brittany Kaiser.

Cambridge Analytica Ltd was a British political consulting firm that came to prominence through the Facebook–Cambridge Analytica data scandal.

Knowing the Cambridge Analytica data scandal with Facebook in the US and other elections they influenced, I was dumbfounded by the thought that data scientists managed to use these data sets to manipulate people by just using ads and somehow filtered it to target specific individuals that they called “persuadables” this explains why social media campaigns from BBM political party here in the Philippines felt like Cambridge Analytica went for it; one of the founders, Alexander Nix, told that it would be a “massive financial opportunity” since the collapsed due to their data scandal.

The effects on Filipino Netizens; I can see it as history being revised through Social Media, and it works, if Cambridge Analytica is behind it? that I do not know, but the majority of Filipino Netizens don’t notice that information overload influences us to cast votes for the candidates that do not deserve the seat, and the common mistake for us Filipinos is that fact-checking is very important nowadays because it’s the age of disinformation, some may believe the smallest bit of information from different social media platforms that have no any supporting details for its legitimacy, it influences them so much that they think all of it is true; too much information is being passed that they can’t even tell what is fake and legit.

From campaign jingles to political advertisements on our televisions, it evolves and passes to our personal smartphones, where we don’t notice that targeting individuals actually work through the use of data and new technologies that are unknown to most of the Netizens that use Social Media.

This may answer the question, of why the majority of voters can’t explain who will be its candidate. For those that are influenced, they‘ve voted not based on the Qualifications and Achievements of the Candidate but based on the fabricated image and brand that is created by any political party that uses Cyber Propaganda.

items.title: Online Classes in the Philippines. Is Mental Health more important than Education?
items.author: Dids Irwyn T. Reyes
items.description:
Maybe you already know the answer, it’s a big Yes?

It’s a question in mind that keeps me awake all day. “Maybe it’s okay to stop for a year or two drops out and come back to school until the pandemic is over.” But you're also constantly worrying about the future, and the time it would waste doing nothing while your peers/batchmates are currently studying online while you’re isolating yourself, depressed, stressed, anxious, and trying to cope up with your mental illness.

Too afraid to voice out? As you will be labeled as weak? Remember that depression is not a sign of weakness, and seeking help is a sign of strength.

Since the sudden spread of Covid-19 around the world affected our daily lives, the economy dropped and some are at risk of losing their livelihoods, most of the companies as well as small businesses closed in compliance with government regulation due to the pandemic and causes a drastic increase in the unemployment rate here in the Philippines.

To provide a solution and resume students learning the Department of Education (DepEd) implemented online learning.

Why did DepEd implement it?

According to DepEd’s, it is an online platform for public school teachers to support distance learning modalities. It was designed as a direct solution to give access to online review materials and Open Educational Resources (OERs) during class suspensions and other similar circumstances. https://www.teacherph.com/deped-online-learning-smartphone-education/

The Commission on Higher Education (CHED) also proposed new normal for tertiary level education.

The Chairman of the Commission of Higher Education Prospero de Vera III announced that flexible learning would be the new normal for tertiary level students. https://www.manilatimes.net/2021/05/24/news/national/flexible-learning-will-be-the-norm-ched/1800408

But did it work? Do students actually learn while at home?

Well, some learn and students do engage in online meetings, but the majority of the students based on my experience, there’s no learning process that takes place, if you have a quiz or exams and if you’re lucky enough to have a good internet connection, Google! Why bother to review if you can search it? Assignments? You just need a friend to copy homework make some changes and you’re good to go. This doesn’t apply to all students but sadly the majority of students know and experience this, how a student will be taught and learn would greatly depend on the teacher/professors assigned, the school you’re currently in, and the student itself.

Here’s a scenario: You have a Teacher/Professor that is very strict when it comes to exams.

You need to open your camera and share your screen during exams so the proctor can monitor you, in some instances, you needed another camera with a different angle to make sure you’re not cheating.

Some can improvise it's their room so students can find a way to cheat, If not memorization will take place.

Memorization ✔️

Learning ❌

Studying did take place but in a way of memorizing terms and keywords for exams but the essence of learning I'm not sure if it did take place, do you remember your last exam? If so what did you learn about it?

Not only do Junior High, Seniors, and Tertiary Level students experience this, middle-grade students did too their attention span is too short for online meetings, without proper guidance, they often zone out. Learning On-Screen is not enough parents hire tutors or teach their kids personally to learn.

DESPITE the challenges to the unprecedented shift to distance learning, the Department of Education (DepEd) said the class opening this school year has been a success. https://www.manilatimes.net/2020/10/30/news/top-stories/distance-learning-a-success-briones/788788

The “opening” of the school year was indeed a success. But the learning process? I guess not. Because living in a third World Country, slow Internet Connection is the main problem for most students that can’t afford high-speed data or network providers.

It’s either the students can’t join online meetings because of network issues or the teacher/professor has a poor internet connection and causes lag or choppy voice while discussing lessons. These are just some of the reasons why students are unable to attend or pass some requirements online. From those small problems that the student experience it creates a small but constant fear of missing out, then Mental Illness exists, from a small problem it will grow eventually, ‘cause first, not all can afford unlimited data a normal student will worry financially how he can keep up using Data Promos, Public School students are not financially stable and doesn’t have the tech/gadgets used for online meetings that’s why some choose to drop out and work part-time instead of finishing schools semester.

Other hindrances are the environment of a student, not all have a private/personal space/own room, an inconsiderate teachers/professors require a clean background, open camera, and no noisy background, most students don’t have the luxury to live in a private residence where you can’t hear any roosters crows, dogs bark and any unnecessary background noise. This gives anxiety and makes the students less confident.

Using web cameras should be optional for online classes to protect the privacy of students, according to guidelines from school representatives part of the Data Privacy Council for the Education Sector. https://cnnphilippines.com/news/2020/9/16/online-learning-guidelines-data-privacy.html

Maybe you’re wondering why online classes are more mentally exhausting than physical?

You don’t need to worry about waking up earlier to commute or go to school. The time allotted for online meetings is less than a physical one. Less hassle, but still why does distance learning are more mentally draining?

Without the physical presence of a teacher, the discussion seems to be boring since it’s optional for students to open their cameras while having a live video conference or meetings, teachers are not sure if someone is really there and listening while they're teaching. You might notice that 5 minutes of non-stop talking without any interaction causes the teacher to randomly call or ask if someone’s still there? Adding up the personal problems or issues a student is currently having inside his/her home.

According to a meta-analysis co-authored by Julianne Holt-Lunstad, Ph.D., a professor of psychology and neuroscience at Brigham Young University, lack of social connection heightens health risks as much as smoking 15 cigarettes a day or having alcohol use disorder. She’s also found that loneliness and social isolation are twice as harmful to physical and mental health as obesity (Perspectives on Psychological Science, Vol. 10, №2, 2015).

Engaging in physical activities and social interaction with peers are very important in the process of learning, it would make the student enjoy learning and more likely to be physically healthy since these activities will create the best moments for students and these benefits a huge part in the mental health of a student it will release chemicals in the brain that makes us happy dopamine, serotonin, oxytocin, and endorphins, all play a role in how we experience happiness.

“In order to keep up, we need to adapt to the changes the pandemic caused us.”

It is not the strongest of the species that survives, nor the most intelligent. It is the one that is most adaptable to change. — Charles Darwin

Adaptation does not happen instantly consider yourself lucky you’re still reading this, just because you dropped out and did not continue to school doesn’t mean you can’t adapt to changes, you did in a very profound way. This is not to encourage students to drop out but to consider each of our mental health. Mental Health matters most, a bachelor’s degree, diploma or any other school achievement doesn’t really matter if you neglected your mental health. Untreated Mental Illness

Always remember as Rudolph Steiner once said, “Education is a journey, not a race” it doesn’t matter how old are you or how slowly you go as long as you keep on going, and don’t ever forget to take a step back.
